required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CD49 in Optimization The Cologenicity of Mesenchymal Stem Cell Culture Passage
clinical_study.official_title: CD49 in Optimization The Cologenicity of Mesenchymal Stem Cell Culture Passage

brief_summary.textblock: Human mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) due to their regenerative and immunomodulatory properties are widely used for the treatment of bone and cartilage damage, cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, autoimmune, neurodegenerative diseases and cancer .It is shown that the use of MSCs in therapy is safe and can be effective .In 2006, the International Society for Cellular Therapy (ISCT) proposed the minimal criteria to define human MSCs. First, MSCs must be plastic-adherent when maintained in the standard culture conditions. Second MSCs must express CD105, CD73 and CD90, and lack expression of CD45, CD34, CD14 or CD11b, CD79a or CD19 and HLA-DR surface molecules.

primary_outcome.measure: evaluation the best passage of MSC culture by CD49 surface marker
primary_outcome.description: evaluation the best passage of MSC culture by CD49 surface marker

intervention.description: take sample of Wharton jelly and culturing it to know the best time for mesenchymal stem cell growth

study_pop.textblock: taking umbilical cord of normally labored babies

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
normal babies delivered by normal labor
Exclusion Criteria:
diseased or congenital anomalies

reference.citation: Lv FJ, Tuan RS, Cheung KM, Leung VY. Concise review: the surface markers and identity of human mesenchymal stem cells. Stem Cells. 2014 Jun;32(6):1408-19. doi: 10.1002/stem.1681. Review.

Madrigal M, Rao KS, Riordan NH. A review of therapeutic effects of mesenchymal stem cell secretions and induction of secretory modification by different culture methods. J Transl Med. 2014 Oct 11;12:260. doi: 10.1186/s12967-014-0260-8. Review.

responsible_party.investigator_title: resident doctor at clinical pathology in Sohag oncology center
